comments.body: @olafurpg maybe you can shed some light on what's happening here: typecheckError seems to emit mixed line endings. My best guess is that line endings are getting inlined from a different compile-time Platform in XtensionPositionFormatMessage but by best guess isn't very good.
Hmm, I am not sure what is happening here. If typecheckError is defined in scalameta, then I'm happy to move the replace there instead of at every callsite.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@      import scala.meta.dialects.Scala211
      val q"type $name[$X] = $Y" = q"type List[+A] = List[A]"
    """).replace("\r", "") === """
      |<macro>:4: not found: value X
      |      val q"type $name[$X] = $Y" = q"type List[+A] = List[A]"
